Text: New email address Cc our new email accounts set up Ken Krisa Jim Osborne Ken Krisa
OGE Termination LetterI did not receive the termination letter at the office today I suspect you have sent it to our old email address Please resend to Thank you Ken Krisa

Wildhorse Cc Thought I would check and see if your thoughts are to still send Wildhorse a letter with our interpretation of the Wildhorse agreement Havent talked to you in a few days and didnt know if there are any new developments Thanks Ken Krisa Crescendo Energy Partners LLC
Wildhorse LetterThis is the letter that went out Minor change to the last paragraph to make it more accurate This will go out today Ken Krisa Dakota Wildhorse ltr doc

Effects to Wildhorse for Entrada GatheringIn response to your request to itemize effects to Wildhorse of moving the Entrada gas from San Arroyo to the BWGP I put together the attached list Audrey and I had a chance to review this yesterday in untyped form and you may want to visit with her as well Audrey also took back some maps yesterday that show the Mesa pipeline and may be helpful in visualizing the gathering system and the issues Please reveiw and lets discuss Also Joan asked another question left on my voicemail I think this question may be from Scott Has Wildhorse been indicating that we can flow to NWPL in the past What is the history here May answer is as follows As far as the Entrada Gas we have always discussed taking it to NWPL and only NWPL Included in the Open Season Offering NG Resources made with Wildhorse we allowed IGI a company that holds firm capacity on NWPL to include a gas purchasing proposal for this gas We really never discussed the Dakota gas delivery to NWPL until JuneJuly We could not change the nominations until October due to the long term gas sales contract assigned to us in the Enogex acquisition We were under the impression that the long term contract was the only reason that Enogex was not selling gas on NWPL Wildhorse changed directions of flow along the old Mesa line in spring of See note in the attached word document I will call you later today to discuss further Ken Krisa Wildhorse affectsdoc
Final Letter to Wildhorsehere is the letter to Wildhorse in final form Waiting to here from you before I send via fax and overnight Ken Krisa Wildhorse ltr doc

FW Production Report Cc Please see the attached production report note the comment under DOWNTIME at the end of the report It indicates Wildhorse pulled out a compressor last week at the San Arroyo Plant and our pressures have increased We are trying to get more information and will pass it along when we get it Ken Krisa Original Message From Jim Sent Monday October AM To Ken Subject FW Production Report Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October AM To Cc Subject Production Report Attached is the production report We are still having high line pressures I will call you after I speak with Wildhorse this morning Dan SASEPxls

Status of Field Pressures and Wildhorse Cc you a copy of the San Arroyo Production Report from Dan Rieneke His report included notes concerning Wildhorse removing a CAT compressor at San Arroyo increased field pressures and comments by Wildhorse field personnel concerning a potential lawsuit with Crescendo over pressure In subsequent conversations between Dan Rieneke and Wildhorse personnel yesterday the following information was relayed The CAT compressor was used only for the Natural Buttes gas being routed through the South Canyon area We are not sure where they took it It was most likely a rental unit Increase in field pressures late last week was due to a compressor going down Overhaul of that unit was not complete until late yesterday Monday and we should have started to see some pressure relief again last evening Putting the compressor back on line will only restore pressures to their levels prior to the shutdown Wildhorse field management will correct any misinformation obtained by their field personnel concerning a lawsuit Ken Krisa Crescendo Energy LLC

November NominationsGerald What is the game plan for November nominations Do we want to go through the same deal as before and nominate on NWPL get rejected and renominate on Questar Or do we want to nominate on Questar and include a statement that we are nominating on Questar only because of last months ordeal Tom Brown and Wildhorse are supposed to close today if they didnt get their late last Friday Ken Krisa

RE November Nominations Cc Gerald I am wondering whether we need to send another letter as we did for the October Nominations to continue to show our intent to nominate of gas to NWPL I think this may take some more thought as I dont want to be given the nomination and then curtailed as other producers are Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Subject Re November Nominations The noms can only be done via the internet if we have a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number And as far as I know they still will not give us one So we can either obtain the WildhorseNWPL transport contract number from Tom Brown and nom via the internet to NWPL if not nom via internet into Questar and fax letter or fax nom to Questar along with letter Mark what do you think our chances of getting a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number are joan To cc Joan CT Mark nron Subject Re November Nominations Document link Joan Quick We should again nominate to NWPL In our nomination we can state that if Wildhorse again wrongfully rejects our nom to NWPL we then nominate to Questar solely to mitigate damages I can draft the appropriate letter Joan or Ken Will the nominations be done via the web site Do we have the information to nominate to NWPL via the website Ken pex To net cc Subject AM Please respond to kckrisa Joan Gerald What is the game plan for November nominations Do we want to go through the same deal as before and nominate on NWPL get rejected and renominate on Questar Or do we want to nominate on Questar and include a statement that we are nominating on Questar only because of last months ordeal Tom Brown and Wildhorse are supposed to close today if they didnt get their late last Friday Ken Krisa

RE November Nominations Cc Would you please draft the letter Thank you Also I havent heard from Wildhorse or Tom Brown today as to when the deal will close Hope it occurred today Ken Krisa Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Subject RE November Nominations Ken Our position has been that Wildhorse doesnt have the right to curtail our volumes since we have a first que position We could draft the letter such that we demand to send of our gas to NWPL In the event that Wildhorse would only accept noms or some portion of this gas to NWPL we would nominate the remainder to Questar to mitigate Wildhorses damages Once they accept the nom to NWPL they have a first que obligation to move it there From a practical standpoint if Wildhorse curtailed us to NWPL to our protest after they had accepted our noms I understand this would cause problems However if we nominate gas to Questar when Wildhorse is willing to accept a nom to NWPL we would potentially be waiving damages there Ken pex To net cc Gerald R Nemec Email Subject RE November Nominations PM Please respond to kckrisa Joan Gerald I am wondering whether we need to send another letter as we did for the October Nominations to continue to show our intent to nominate of gas to NWPL I think this may take some more thought as I dont want to be given the nomination and then curtailed as other producers are Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Subject Re November Nominations The noms can only be done via the internet if we have a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number And as far as I know they still will not give us one So we can either obtain the WildhorseNWPL transport contract number from Tom Brown and nom via the internet to NWPL if not nom via internet into Questar and fax letter or fax nom to Questar along with letter Mark what do you think our chances of getting a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number are joan To cc Joan CT Mark nron Subject Re November Nominations Document link Joan Quick We should again nominate to NWPL In our nomination we can state that if Wildhorse again wrongfully rejects our nom to NWPL we then nominate to Questar solely to mitigate damages I can draft the appropriate letter Joan or Ken Will the nominations be done via the web site Do we have the information to nominate to NWPL via the website Ken pex To net cc Subject AM Please respond to kckrisa Joan Gerald What is the game plan for November nominations Do we want to go through the same deal as before and nominate on NWPL get rejected and renominate on Questar Or do we want to nominate on Questar and include a statement that we are nominating on Questar only because of last months ordeal Tom Brown and Wildhorse are supposed to close today if they didnt get their late last Friday Ken Krisa

Confidentiality Agreement sent by Tom BrownArvel asked I forward this to you Received yesterday evening It is definitely a one way deal the way it is presented I am in the process of making some changes that I would like to propose back to TBI I will forward those to you as well should be this afternoon I wont send anything back until we talk further Ken Krisa CA with Crescendodoc

Revisions to TBI Confidentiality Agreement Gerald See the attached file These are the changes I had in mind if we use the TBI Confidentiality Agreement as the base document TBI indicated their desire to use this document Ready to discuss when you are Ken Krisa Revised CA Crescendo TBI doc

RE Cescendo January NomsI think we need to again followup the January nominations with the appropriate letter to Wildhorse about the nominations to NWPL If you agree can you please forward a draft to me Thx Ken Krisa Original Message From mailto Sent Wednesday December PM To Subject Cescendo January Noms After talking with Liz Orr I think its best to make the Jan nom at MMBtud Any additional production would be applied to the Wildhorse imbalance joan Forwarded by Joan QuickHOUECT on PM From Joan Quick on AM To cc Subject January noms per dan i am using mcfd and mmbtud let me know if i should adjust this joan Forwarded by Joan QuickHOUECT on PM From Joan Quick on PM To Stacey J CT cc Subject crescendo january noms use mcfd remember the Wildhorse nom is in mcfs around mmbtud See attached file nomsxls

Agency AgreementI am sorry for the delay in getting to the Agency Agreement It hasnt been at the top of my priority list I have reviewed it this past week One question I have typically I have seen these agreements with an indemnity clause included I noticed that the agreement proposed does not have an indemnity clause I would like to discuss this with you Lets discuss next week and get the agreement done Again sorry for the delay Ken Krisa

Covernsation with Petrie Parkman Co WEP Acquisition Cc a call late yesterday from Mr Bill Garner at Petrie Parkman Company concerning the Wildhorse divestiture by Tom Brown Since we already have a confidentiality agreement with Tom Brown a package will be sent to us today overnight assuming printing goes as planned The data room will be opened up either late next week th th or early the following week th at KNs office in Denver Bill indicated that the Wildhorse assets are being split up into various pieces major groupings West East and Rulison a Of the West piece there will be major subgroups Northern Southwest b Of the Southwest piece which we looked at the assets are being presented as subgroups Westwater BarX Premier BarX Pine Springs San Arroyo South Canyon Bill could not tell me where the Badger Wash Field gathering piece falls under during the phone call Bill indicated that you can bid on any individual piece or all pieces or any combination thereof I indicated interest in seeing the information for the entire Western part of the system Ken Krisa

Revised letter concerning Confidentiality AgreementAttached is the letter to Tom Brown concerning confidentiality for the transaction with changes made as requested by Tom Brown The only change requested was to change Third Parties to potential investment partners Third Parties capitalized is not defined as part of the original agreement Also attached is a draft document listing items to be quantified for damages We are already beginning the process to quantify the value of each item and document the events timing etc This list is for discussion purposes only at this point Ken Krisa TBI CA letter agreement doc Contract Issues doc

Agency AgreementAfter our discussion on Friday I am sending the Agency Agreement back to you with some minor markups that I would like to see made I did not include an indemnity section at this time As you indicated Friday you wanted to think about that After review please call me if you have any questions After we agree on the changes you can either draft two originals and sent to me or I can print two originals execute and send to you however you prefer Ken Krisa Crescendoagency revdoc

Third Pary Processing Proposal Letter of IntentGerald Attached is the proposed Third Party Processing Proposal Letter of Intent Please review Audrey need your help to review the processing numbers Ken LM Processing Proposal Ltr doc

Confidentiality Agreement Letter to TBI Cc Mark Can you please have a copy of this document executed today as soon as possible by someone at Enron and then fax to Bob Mustard at Tom Brown Inc His fax number is His phone number is direct number I am executing originals and will sent to Houston for signature Marks attention These originals can then be sent to Bob for TBI signature Thanks Ken TBI CA letter agreement doc
Wildhorse AssetsAccording to Bob Mustard the Wildhorse assets have been put in TBI Field Services Inc This entity was specifically set up for the Wildhorse assets Ken Krisa
Letter of Intent to Lone MountainDid you have a chance to review the letter of intent to Lone Mountain for gas processing Ken Krisa

RE Revised Agency Agreementit looks fine I will make accept changes correct the item numbers change LLC on Crescendo Energy to LLC and send you two signed copies Thx Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Friday January AM To Cc Subject Revised Agency Agreement Ken Attached is the revised agency agreement I accepted all you changes you forwarded earlier and added an indemnity section Please review and let me know if you want to discuss See attached file Crescendoagency revdoc

Gathering System PSAreceived the proposed PSA for the Wildhorse acquisition from Petrie Parkman today I have attached for everyones review We are required to send back to TBI with proposed changes with our proposal Mark would you please forward to those who need to see it besides Audrey and Gerald Thx Ken Krisa PSADOC

RE Gathering System PSAWe have been unofficially informed that the bids are due back on February I was hoping to be ready one week earlier than that I am trying to get the total package to ENA mid next week I have not yet even looked at the package TBI mentioned that markups to the PSA and the gathering agreement for TBI reserves you should also have a copy of it from Audrey would be considered heavily in the bid evaluation process Therefore I would like to keep the changes to those required and not cosmetic or druthers We will need to review both contracts I will try to get the TBI gas gathering agreement as an electronic file today Thx Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday January PM To Subject Re Gathering System PSA What is the time frame This agreement looks to need significant revisions Ken pex To Audrey ONeil Email Gerald R net Nemec Email Mark Castiglione Email cc PM Subject Gathering System PSA Please respond to kckrisa I received the proposed PSA for the Wildhorse acquisition from Petrie Parkman today I have attached for everyones review We are required to send back to TBI with proposed changes with our proposal Mark would you please forward to those who need to see it besides Audrey and Gerald Thx Ken Krisa See attached file PSADOC

TBI Standard Gas Gathering Agreement for TBI volumesHere is the gas gathering agreement proposed by TBI for their South Canyon reserves We are supposed to fill in all the blanks Ken Krisa STD GATH AGRMT doc

Unprofitability ClauseHere is the unprofitabilty Clause Wildhorse put in their proposed revised San Arroyo contract to us Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement to the contrary if in the sole opinion of Gatherer the continued operation of Gatherers Gathering systems or any portion thereof or the providing of Gathering Services hereunder becomes unprofitable or uneconomical to Gatherer for whatever reasons then Gatherer shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty Days advance written notice to Shipper Ken

Tom Brown Gathering Agreement Cc I finally spoke with Tom Brown Tom Brown expects the contract for gathering to be fully interruptable with only the wells currently connected to the Wildhorse system now are to be included in the dedication of wells The obligation for us to move any gas is contingent that the gas will meet pipeline specs Thought the blending fee was a good idea but bringing gas to a plant for processing would be negotiated at a later time Bob doesnt know the South Canyon play very well or there existing contract He indicated that not only the price but some other changes in terms was desired not sure which ones are the most important If you need anything else let me know Gerald if you get your revisions over the weekend please email to me right away I will pick it up I can also be reached on my cell phone

Bid Response letter to Petrie Parkman for Wildhorse BidThis is the bid response letter for the Wildhorse assets Any comments on it I dont mention anything about the lawsuit or turning in a proposal to TBI for acquisition of their production assets at South Canyon We also want to turn in on the th a proposal to Tom Brown separate letter separate proposal for acquisition of there South Canyon production assets We will be discussing this on Tuesday morning meeting in Houston with Scott and Steve and the crew I think your presence may be needed Ken TBI Field Services bid response doc

Conversation with Petrie Parkman on WEP acquisition Cc had a conversation with Bill Garner at Petrie Parkman late Wednesday afternoon Tom Brown representatives are not discussing the status of the WEP acquisition with any entities Bill informed us that they are in negotiations with a single entity for the entire Wildhorse Package as included in the data room plus some additional Colorado assets that were not included in the package Bill also informed us and the reason he returned our call is that he indicated he believes the entity would be friendly to Crescendo and has expressed interest to them in working with us on our project and plans We reminded him that there are still issues with our existing contract that need to be expediently resolved and we arent going to wait months to resolve these issues He assured us that Tom Brown is very aware of contractual issues He indicated that the entity wanted to contact Crescendo now before execution of the PSA but TBI insists on working through PSA issues before contact with Crescendo A PSA review meeting is scheduled for next week Bill said he would make introductions for us as soon as the PSA is executed Bill also informed us that it was TBI management that made the decision to sell all the assets instead of breaking up even if breaking up brought a higher sale price Ken Krisa

PSA for Harley Dome OG Acquisition Cc I am sending you the PSA and Escrow agreement for the acquisition of the Harley Dome Oil and Gas Leases This lease contains mostly helium reserves with little oil or gas value We plan to execute this PSA with the Oil and Gas Owner next week and put the downpayment in escrow at our bank here in Midland We expect a due diligence period of months due to waiting on the outcome of the lawsuit involving the helium rights owner or agreement on a deal with the helium rights owner There are no producing wells on the acreage all PAd or TAd We would do some due diligence upon execution Scott asked me to have you look at the agreement We have worked with Bill Ward at Pruitt Gushee Bachtel PGB on this agreement it is pretty much our standard PSA and he looks at all our agreements I believe PGB has been approved by ENA The strategy here is that if we obtain the oil and gas rights then we believe we lock up the oil and gas leases covering the existing helium rights owned by another entity We are using this as leverage to get a better deal from the helium rights owner As listed in Article the acquisition wouldnt close until final approval by members of Crescendo We are prepared to risk and its not really even at risk based on the termination provisions in Article the downpayment to work a deal with the helium rights owner Lets discuss ASAP Thanks Ken RMOC Purchase Sale Agrmnt PGBdoc RMOC PurchaseExB PGBdoc

Nominations on NWPL Cc Im writing this email to you because Joan is out this week I need to find out why we are not nominated on NWPL for the month of March for our San Arroyo gas We specifically requested nomination on NWPL Are the VPP volumes on NWPL or Questar If they are on Questar then we need to have a letter agreement for March between Crescendo and now Brazos Can you please find out who I can talk to about this as soon as possible Thanks Ken

Acquisition of Wildhorse Gathering Assets Cc Jim and I had a discussion with Tom Brown Bob Mustard and the potential new owners of the Wildhorse assets The name of the company is Cantera Resources Inc They have offices in Dallas and Denver They are a midstream gathering and processing company predominately owned by Morgan Stanley Dean Witter They recently about months ago purchased the processing assets from TXU The two gentlemen from Cantera on the line were Dave Kenyon Denver and Terry Klare Dallas They wanted to know about the Entrada gas and our lowBtu gas plans We indicated that we are in the process of building a MMSCFD plant at the South Canyon interconnect Also indicated that while the San Arroyo gas was currently covered under an existing gathering agreement the Badger Wash gas was not dedicated We indicated that we wanted to bring mmscfd from San Arroyo and we could move anywhere from mmscfd from Badger Wash All wells are drilled We did not discuss third party gas They indicated they are very interested in working with us on this lowBtu project They also indicated that the only way they make money is by moving gas as much as possible The PSA for the transaction has not been executed at this time Both parties indicated they expect to sign the PSA next week with closing soon thereafter no timeframe given Once the PSA is signed TBI has no objections to discussions between Crescendo and Cantera to proceed without TBI Dave and Terry indicated they wanted to enter into more serious discussions with us as soon as the PSA is signed Athough Bob did indicate to Cantera that there were issues with the San Arroyo Gathering Agreement we did not discuss any of the other issues with the contract as the conversation was brief and more of an introduction of us to them Ken Krisa

San Arroyo Gathering Agreement Issues Package Cc I have forwarded via overnight carrier four originals of a package describing and quantifying all issues with Wildhorse or Tom Brown Field Services related to the San Arroyo Gathering Agreement Please distribute one copy to Andrew Edison one copy to Gerald Nemec one copy to Scott Josey The other copy is for your review and files Please call or email me when you receive the package Thx Ken Krisa
Compressor Rental AgreementHave you had a chance to look at the Compressor Rental Agreement for the Badger Wash Gas Plant Ken Krisa

RE Compressor Rental Agreement Cc I do not have a copy of the agreement on disk This is also a critical path item for the project based on delivery time quoted Talk to you next week Ken Krisa Original Message From mailto Sent Friday April PM To Subject Re Compressor Rental Agreement Ken I have read through the agreement I think this agreement need some fairly significant revisions It is extremely onesided as currently written I will write up my comments and get those to you early next week Ken pex To Gerald R Nemec Email net cc Subject Compressor Rental Agreement AM Please respond to kckrisa Gerald Have you had a chance to look at the Compressor Rental Agreement for the Badger Wash Gas Plant Ken Krisa
Compressor Maintenance AgreementSee attached file for the Compressor Contract I wrote this Universal has not seen this yet Ken Compressor Maintenance Agreementdoc

Proposed changes to Contract in letter formhere is my first pass at the changes with specific wording to be given back to Universal I didnt do any words on Section thought you might look at one more time and suggest the words Also I did change the f provision some didnt like theirs at all Lets discuss as soon as possible Ken Barry Loyd ltr compr Contractdoc

Universal Legal Contact Cc As you may have discussed with Dave Owen I gave your name and phone number to the Universal representative I am working with here in Midland Their lawyer in Houston should be contacting you either late today or tomorrow morning concerning or questions he has on the rental agreement Once you both clear up the questions we will execute the rental agreement His name is Mark Carter He is aware that you work for Enron but represent Crescendos interests Thanks Call if you have any questions Ken Krisa

Meeting Notes Meeting between Crescendo and CanteraGerald Attached is the meeting notes from a hour meeting we had with Cantera Resources and Tom Brown on April We will be meeting with them again on Monday May in Dallas This meeting will involve the president and operations manager of Cantera as well While the last meeting was more of introductions and high level where we are and what are the issues discusssion this meeting will be more definitive where we plan to discuss the pressure and curtailment issues in more detail and we will be discussing moving the Entrada from San Arroyo to our plant I am sure they will also want to discuss some sort of agreement for us to move foreward together on the lowBtu project Tom Brown representatives will be involved via phone as they must until the deal closes We told Cantera it may be a very short meeting as there are certain things we wont talk about in front of Tom Brown In our meeting on Monday which will start at noon with lunch I want to be able to show them a couple of things I want to show them Graphs A and B and Figure out of section of the Contract Issues book I gave you I want to also show them Graphs A and B and Figures out of section of the book I was not planning on discussing the monitary value associated with these graphs the sum of these issues totals just under MM economic harm to Crescendo as I calculated from June through December Andrew I will call you in the morning to discuss in more detail what we should and should not show them or discuss concerning the issues I will be on my cell phone at all morning Thanks Ken Krisa meeting notes Canteradoc

Letter to Tom Brown Cc As we discussed here is my first pass at a letter to Tom Brown concerning the contract issues as I discussed with them in my May meeting with TBI and Cantera Cantera has executed the PSA for the acquisition of the assets and will be closing in weeks The excel spreadsheet has several graphs included in the workbook Only the first graphs were given to Cantera and Tom Brown the overall combination and west lateral graphs The others were not given to TBI The remaining graphs and figures handed out in the meeting and referenced in the letter are included in the Contracts Issue book I forwarded to you earlier Please review ASAP I would like to get in the overnight tonight if at all possible I have not yet decided who copies should go to whether a copy of this letter needs to go to Kinder Morgan folks old Wildhorse as well Ken Krisa Press vs Prod Graphs mtgxls TBI Ltr doc
Revised Letter to TBI Cc Attached is the revisions to the letter as we discussed Please feel free to make any changes you deem necessary Ken Krisa TBI Ltr finaldoc

NWPL Facility AgreementAttached is a copy of the NWPL facilities agreement This will be coupled with an OBA between NWPL and Crescendo Energy As we discussed please take a look at it Thx Ken Krisa CrescendoFAdoc
Operating AgreementGerald Here is the version with my marks Ken BCCKOP BWGP Op Agreement kck rev doc

BCCKOP Operating AgreementGerald Here is a revised copy of the agreement I added some strong safety language in Section which I need you to look at Also I dont see a Failure to Perform provision is this covered somewhere else Also want to discuss the Remedy in case of Default provisions I dont want BCCKOP to be able to shut the facility down and hold us hostage for payment of something I want them to be able to terminate the agreement and then orderly shutdown the facility and then leave Otherwise we keep on operating Lets discuss Also added words on Schedule F Ken Krisa BCCKOP BWGP Op Agreement kckdoc
Operating Agreement for BWGP Cc Gloria Here is the redlined version of the proposed operating agreement Ken BWGP Op Agreement revdoc

Crescendo Gathering System AcquisitionGerald We are in discussion with Public Service Company of Colorado about acquiring a small gathering system just north of the Badger Wash Gas Plant The attached document gives a little background of the transaction and lists some of my questions concerning this transaction After you review the document I would like to discuss these issues with you to be sure we have addressed all Crescendos risks and obligations Thanks Ken Krisa PSCO Acquisition Legal Questionsdoc

NWPL Facility AgreementAttached is a copy of the NWPL facilities agreement This will be coupled with an OBA between NWPL and Crescendo Energy As we discussed please take a look at it Thx Ken Krisa CrescendoFAdoc
Revised Letter to TBI Cc Attached is the revisions to the letter as we discussed Please feel free to make any changes you deem necessary Ken Krisa TBI Ltr finaldoc

Letter to Tom Brown Cc As we discussed here is my first pass at a letter to Tom Brown concerning the contract issues as I discussed with them in my May meeting with TBI and Cantera Cantera has executed the PSA for the acquisition of the assets and will be closing in weeks The excel spreadsheet has several graphs included in the workbook Only the first graphs were given to Cantera and Tom Brown the overall combination and west lateral graphs The others were not given to TBI The remaining graphs and figures handed out in the meeting and referenced in the letter are included in the Contracts Issue book I forwarded to you earlier Please review ASAP I would like to get in the overnight tonight if at all possible I have not yet decided who copies should go to whether a copy of this letter needs to go to Kinder Morgan folks old Wildhorse as well Ken Krisa Press vs Prod Graphs mtgxls TBI Ltr doc

Universal Legal Contact Cc As you may have discussed with Dave Owen I gave your name and phone number to the Universal representative I am working with here in Midland Their lawyer in Houston should be contacting you either late today or tomorrow morning concerning or questions he has on the rental agreement Once you both clear up the questions we will execute the rental agreement His name is Mark Carter He is aware that you work for Enron but represent Crescendos interests Thanks Call if you have any questions Ken Krisa

Nominations on NWPL Cc Im writing this email to you because Joan is out this week I need to find out why we are not nominated on NWPL for the month of March for our San Arroyo gas We specifically requested nomination on NWPL Are the VPP volumes on NWPL or Questar If they are on Questar then we need to have a letter agreement for March between Crescendo and now Brazos Can you please find out who I can talk to about this as soon as possible Thanks Ken

PSA for Harley Dome OG Acquisition Cc I am sending you the PSA and Escrow agreement for the acquisition of the Harley Dome Oil and Gas Leases This lease contains mostly helium reserves with little oil or gas value We plan to execute this PSA with the Oil and Gas Owner next week and put the downpayment in escrow at our bank here in Midland We expect a due diligence period of months due to waiting on the outcome of the lawsuit involving the helium rights owner or agreement on a deal with the helium rights owner There are no producing wells on the acreage all PAd or TAd We would do some due diligence upon execution Scott asked me to have you look at the agreement We have worked with Bill Ward at Pruitt Gushee Bachtel PGB on this agreement it is pretty much our standard PSA and he looks at all our agreements I believe PGB has been approved by ENA The strategy here is that if we obtain the oil and gas rights then we believe we lock up the oil and gas leases covering the existing helium rights owned by another entity We are using this as leverage to get a better deal from the helium rights owner As listed in Article the acquisition wouldnt close until final approval by members of Crescendo We are prepared to risk and its not really even at risk based on the termination provisions in Article the downpayment to work a deal with the helium rights owner Lets discuss ASAP Thanks Ken RMOC Purchase Sale Agrmnt PGBdoc RMOC PurchaseExB PGBdoc

Conversation with Petrie Parkman on WEP acquisition Cc had a conversation with Bill Garner at Petrie Parkman late Wednesday afternoon Tom Brown representatives are not discussing the status of the WEP acquisition with any entities Bill informed us that they are in negotiations with a single entity for the entire Wildhorse Package as included in the data room plus some additional Colorado assets that were not included in the package Bill also informed us and the reason he returned our call is that he indicated he believes the entity would be friendly to Crescendo and has expressed interest to them in working with us on our project and plans We reminded him that there are still issues with our existing contract that need to be expediently resolved and we arent going to wait months to resolve these issues He assured us that Tom Brown is very aware of contractual issues He indicated that the entity wanted to contact Crescendo now before execution of the PSA but TBI insists on working through PSA issues before contact with Crescendo A PSA review meeting is scheduled for next week Bill said he would make introductions for us as soon as the PSA is executed Bill also informed us that it was TBI management that made the decision to sell all the assets instead of breaking up even if breaking up brought a higher sale price Ken Krisa

Bid Response letter to Petrie Parkman for Wildhorse BidThis is the bid response letter for the Wildhorse assets Any comments on it I dont mention anything about the lawsuit or turning in a proposal to TBI for acquisition of their production assets at South Canyon We also want to turn in on the th a proposal to Tom Brown separate letter separate proposal for acquisition of there South Canyon production assets We will be discussing this on Tuesday morning meeting in Houston with Scott and Steve and the crew I think your presence may be needed Ken TBI Field Services bid response doc

Tom Brown Gathering Agreement Cc I finally spoke with Tom Brown Tom Brown expects the contract for gathering to be fully interruptable with only the wells currently connected to the Wildhorse system now are to be included in the dedication of wells The obligation for us to move any gas is contingent that the gas will meet pipeline specs Thought the blending fee was a good idea but bringing gas to a plant for processing would be negotiated at a later time Bob doesnt know the South Canyon play very well or there existing contract He indicated that not only the price but some other changes in terms was desired not sure which ones are the most important If you need anything else let me know Gerald if you get your revisions over the weekend please email to me right away I will pick it up I can also be reached on my cell phone

Unprofitability ClauseHere is the unprofitabilty Clause Wildhorse put in their proposed revised San Arroyo contract to us Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement to the contrary if in the sole opinion of Gatherer the continued operation of Gatherers Gathering systems or any portion thereof or the providing of Gathering Services hereunder becomes unprofitable or uneconomical to Gatherer for whatever reasons then Gatherer shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty Days advance written notice to Shipper Ken

RE Gathering System PSAWe have been unofficially informed that the bids are due back on February I was hoping to be ready one week earlier than that I am trying to get the total package to ENA mid next week I have not yet even looked at the package TBI mentioned that markups to the PSA and the gathering agreement for TBI reserves you should also have a copy of it from Audrey would be considered heavily in the bid evaluation process Therefore I would like to keep the changes to those required and not cosmetic or druthers We will need to review both contracts I will try to get the TBI gas gathering agreement as an electronic file today Thx Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday January PM To Subject Re Gathering System PSA What is the time frame This agreement looks to need significant revisions Ken pex To Audrey ONeil Email Gerald R net Nemec Email Mark Castiglione Email cc PM Subject Gathering System PSA Please respond to kckrisa I received the proposed PSA for the Wildhorse acquisition from Petrie Parkman today I have attached for everyones review We are required to send back to TBI with proposed changes with our proposal Mark would you please forward to those who need to see it besides Audrey and Gerald Thx Ken Krisa See attached file PSADOC

Covernsation with Petrie Parkman Co WEP Acquisition Cc a call late yesterday from Mr Bill Garner at Petrie Parkman Company concerning the Wildhorse divestiture by Tom Brown Since we already have a confidentiality agreement with Tom Brown a package will be sent to us today overnight assuming printing goes as planned The data room will be opened up either late next week th th or early the following week th at KNs office in Denver Bill indicated that the Wildhorse assets are being split up into various pieces major groupings West East and Rulison a Of the West piece there will be major subgroups Northern Southwest b Of the Southwest piece which we looked at the assets are being presented as subgroups Westwater BarX Premier BarX Pine Springs San Arroyo South Canyon Bill could not tell me where the Badger Wash Field gathering piece falls under during the phone call Bill indicated that you can bid on any individual piece or all pieces or any combination thereof I indicated interest in seeing the information for the entire Western part of the system Ken Krisa

Effects to Wildhorse for Entrada GatheringIn response to your request to itemize effects to Wildhorse of moving the Entrada gas from San Arroyo to the BWGP I put together the attached list Audrey and I had a chance to review this yesterday in untyped form and you may want to visit with her as well Audrey also took back some maps yesterday that show the Mesa pipeline and may be helpful in visualizing the gathering system and the issues Please reveiw and lets discuss Also Joan asked another question left on my voicemail I think this question may be from Scott Has Wildhorse been indicating that we can flow to NWPL in the past What is the history here May answer is as follows As far as the Entrada Gas we have always discussed taking it to NWPL and only NWPL Included in the Open Season Offering NG Resources made with Wildhorse we allowed IGI a company that holds firm capacity on NWPL to include a gas purchasing proposal for this gas We really never discussed the Dakota gas delivery to NWPL until JuneJuly We could not change the nominations until October due to the long term gas sales contract assigned to us in the Enogex acquisition We were under the impression that the long term contract was the only reason that Enogex was not selling gas on NWPL Wildhorse changed directions of flow along the old Mesa line in spring of See note in the attached word document I will call you later today to discuss further Ken Krisa Wildhorse affectsdoc

FW Production Report Cc Please see the attached production report note the comment under DOWNTIME at the end of the report It indicates Wildhorse pulled out a compressor last week at the San Arroyo Plant and our pressures have increased We are trying to get more information and will pass it along when we get it Ken Krisa Original Message From Jim Sent Monday October AM To Ken Subject FW Production Report Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October AM To Cc Subject Production Report Attached is the production report We are still having high line pressures I will call you after I speak with Wildhorse this morning Dan SASEPxls

Status of Field Pressures and Wildhorse Cc you a copy of the San Arroyo Production Report from Dan Rieneke His report included notes concerning Wildhorse removing a CAT compressor at San Arroyo increased field pressures and comments by Wildhorse field personnel concerning a potential lawsuit with Crescendo over pressure In subsequent conversations between Dan Rieneke and Wildhorse personnel yesterday the following information was relayed The CAT compressor was used only for the Natural Buttes gas being routed through the South Canyon area We are not sure where they took it It was most likely a rental unit Increase in field pressures late last week was due to a compressor going down Overhaul of that unit was not complete until late yesterday Monday and we should have started to see some pressure relief again last evening Putting the compressor back on line will only restore pressures to their levels prior to the shutdown Wildhorse field management will correct any misinformation obtained by their field personnel concerning a lawsuit Ken Krisa Crescendo Energy LLC

RE November Nominations Cc Gerald I am wondering whether we need to send another letter as we did for the October Nominations to continue to show our intent to nominate of gas to NWPL I think this may take some more thought as I dont want to be given the nomination and then curtailed as other producers are Ken Original Message From mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Subject Re November Nominations The noms can only be done via the internet if we have a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number And as far as I know they still will not give us one So we can either obtain the WildhorseNWPL transport contract number from Tom Brown and nom via the internet to NWPL if not nom via internet into Questar and fax letter or fax nom to Questar along with letter Mark what do you think our chances of getting a WildhorseNWPL transport contract number are joan To cc Joan CT Mark nron Subject Re November Nominations Document link Joan Quick We should again nominate to NWPL In our nomination we can state that if Wildhorse again wrongfully rejects our nom to NWPL we then nominate to Questar solely to mitigate damages I can draft the appropriate letter Joan or Ken Will the nominations be done via the web site Do we have the information to nominate to NWPL via the website Ken pex To net cc Subject AM Please respond to kckrisa Joan Gerald What is the game plan for November nominations Do we want to go through the same deal as before and nominate on NWPL get rejected and renominate on Questar Or do we want to nominate on Questar and include a statement that we are nominating on Questar only because of last months ordeal Tom Brown and Wildhorse are supposed to close today if they didnt get their late last Friday Ken Krisa

Message From mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Subject RE November Nominations Ken Our position has been that Wildhorse doesnt have the right to curtail our volumes since we have a first que position We could draft the letter such that we demand to send of our gas to NWPL In the event that Wildhorse would only accept noms or some portion of this gas to NWPL we would nominate the remainder to Questar to mitigate Wildhorses damages Once they accept the nom to NWPL they have a first que obligation to move it there From a practical standpoint if Wildhorse curtailed us to NWPL to our protest after they had accepted our noms I understand this would cause problems However if we nominate gas to Questar when Wildhorse is willing to accept a nom to NWPL we would potentially be waiving
